result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Scribner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: First 6 months in jail, second 6 months can be on Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $3,149.83 to Bushman Motors (for 12CF307) and $100 to Tomorrow River BP (for 14CF326).  
Any bond money posted shall be applied to the restitution. 
Monthly payment of atleast $200 per month for restitution. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Comply with all conditions set forth in 12CF307.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey A Scribner in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 12CF307, 14CF326
8:42 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
No victims are present. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lueschow makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
12CF307 Count 1 -
Imposed & Stayed - 1 year jail
First 6 months in jail, second 6 months can be on Electronic Monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 1 year: 
Pay restitution of $3,149.83 to Bushman Motors and $100 to Tomorrow River BP.
Any bond money posted shall be applied to the restitution. 
Pay costs and 10% restitution surcharge.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge.
Monthly payment of at least $200 per month for restitution. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from one pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases so the agent can monitor his medications. 
Engage in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Undergo any other assessment or evaluations deemed appropriate by agent including AODA if deemed necessary.  Court believes that should be conducted as well. 

Court questions Atty Cousins re: 6 months jail sentence. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 
Court does not order. 

14CF326 -
Imposed & Stayed - 1 year jail
First 6 months in jail, second 6 months can be on Electronic Monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 1 year, concurrent with 12CF307:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 12CF307. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Court questions if there is pre-trial incarceration credit. 
Atty Lueschow indicates he has 10 days. 
BY THE COURT:  There is no jail credit. 
Both parties keep their copies of the PSI in their files confidentially.

Defendant Jeffrey A Scribner in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 12CF307, 14CF326

9:19 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Court has been informed that copies of the PSI were not forwarded to counsel.  One has now been provided to them.  Matter to be rescheduled to allow for counsel to review the PSI and for Atty Lueschow to review it with her client. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Court calls case at 3:11  p.m.  Cases 12CF307 and 14CF326 are heard today.
Defendant Jeffrey A Scribner in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Constable request a few moments to revamp the plea agreement form. 
Court back in session on this case at 3:27 p.m.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  Pleas to 12CF307 and 14CF326 Count 3.  14CF326 Count 1, 2, & 4 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
12CF307: No Contest
14CF326: Count 3: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
 
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 12CF307 and 14CF326 Count 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  14CF326 Count 1, 2, & 4 are Dismissed and Read In.

Victims were notified.


BY THE COURT:  PSI report is ordered to be given to the parties by April 3, 2015.

Bond is continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on January 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey A Scribner in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-326 and 12CF-307.

9:47 AM Court calls cases.

Atty Constable states that the information has not been completed as of yet but the charges will be the same as in the complaint. Atty Constable will file an information later today.

Court reviews the file.

Atty Lueschow wishes to proceed today without an information but knowing that it will be filed within 24 hours.

Atty Luechow enters NOT GUILTY pleas on all counts.

Court requests counsel to file a pretrial report.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond continued.

Defendant Jeffrey A Scribner in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.


  Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey A Scribner in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant makes statements.  Has not had time to consult with an attorney. 
Court advises defendant to see the Public Defender representative today. 
Court will adjourn for 2 weeks. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADA  Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:37 PM Court calls case.


ADA  Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Unauthorized Use of an Individual's Identifying Information and Felony Bailjumping counts.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Atty Knaapen refers to 12CF-307.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  September 02, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *David Hintz, if bond is posted or not.  Do not own or maintain a checking account; do not issue or negotiate any checks. Comply with all the bond conditions in 12CF-307.
